MakeSPP

May 26th, 2018

Learn, make, and share innovative projects with
100+ high school students.

Register

Build the future of technology, science, and engineering at MakeSPP.


Join us for a day-long Make-A-Thon that will bring over 100 innovative students. Make cool projects, meet other passionate students, and learn alongside amazing mentors.

If you're planning on coding an app for the first time, or an experienced engineer looking to build an electric car, join us for an awesome day of making!

Location



Saint Peter's Preparatory High School

144 Grand St, Jersey City, NJ 07302


FAQ



What is a Make-A-Thon?

A Make-A-Thon is a gathering of like-minded and passionate students to make their ideas into a reality. Learn new technologies, ask questions, meet other passionate makers, and have fun!

Who can attend?

Any high school student in North NJ or Greater New York City area is free to partipate.

What if I'm a beginner?

Don't worry! We're here to get you started. Be ready to learn a ton from mentors and have a lot of fun with your teammates!

What should I bring?

You should bring your materials for your project, laptop, chargers, phone, and most importantly, ideas! All food, drinks, and snacks will be taken care of.

What if I don't have a team?

Don't worry! We'll have a team formation workshop at the beginning of the event.

Questions?

Email us here.
